abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Water Supply and
            Sanitation in Low-Income Communities Project for Panama were
            as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            policy development activities are attractive activities to
            drop during execution given the general difficulties in
            implementing the activities, especially across government
            administration changes, as well as their typical low-weight
            in terms of budget assignments. Projects design should not
            rely heavily on structures that are not established at the
            outset given the probability that changes in political will
            or other unexpected occurrences can impact their creation.
            Tariff schemes should not be applied uniformly but should
            reflect the capacity and dynamics of each community. It is
            important to be sensitive to the cultural context and
            stakeholder perceptions regarding income classifications.
